conditions.name: Clear skies with moon illumination under 2%
conditions.suggestion: Perfect night for astrophotography. Use long exposure for star trails.
conditions.precautions: Ensure your camera has a stable tripod to avoid shake.

conditions.name: Clear skies with moon illumination above 2%
conditions.suggestion: Clear skies are great for photography, but the moon will wash out faint stars.
conditions.bestTime: During the waning phase of the moon.
conditions.precautions: Use a moon filter to reduce glare. The moon can overpower other celestial objects in your frame.

conditions.name: Partly cloudy with moon illumination under 2%
conditions.suggestion: Good conditions for capturing the stars, though clouds may obscure parts of the sky.
conditions.precautions: Monitor the sky for moving clouds that could obscure your view.

conditions.name: Partly cloudy with moon illumination above 2%
conditions.suggestion: The moon will be visible, and the clouds may block parts of it. Avoid capturing the moon.
conditions.precautions: Clouds may obstruct the moon's visibility and affect your shot.

conditions.name: Light rain
conditions.suggestion: Not ideal for photography. Wait for clearer weather.

conditions.name: Windy with moon illumination under 2%
conditions.suggestion: Wind may affect the stability of your camera. Use a tripod with a stabilizing weight.

idealCameraSettings.shutterSpeed: Varies depending on the wind speed

conditions.bestTime: Wait for a calmer moment or use stabilization equipment
conditions.precautions: Ensure your tripod is steady and secure.

conditions.name: Windy with moon illumination above 2%
conditions.suggestion: The moon will add unwanted brightness to the scene, and the wind could affect your shot.

idealCameraSettings.shutterSpeed: Varies depending on the wind speed

conditions.precautions: Stabilize your tripod and avoid capturing the moon if it's too bright.

conditions.name: Foggy
conditions.suggestion: Fog may obscure your view of the night sky. Wait for better visibility before setting up your camera.
conditions.precautions: Fog can blur images, especially stars in long exposures.

conditions.name: Snow
conditions.suggestion: Snow can create a beautiful night scene, but be aware of cold temperatures affecting your gear.
conditions.precautions: Keep your camera warm and dry. Snow can cause condensation inside the lens.

conditions.name: Snow with moon
conditions.suggestion: The snow reflects too much light from the moon, washing out faint stars.
conditions.bestTime: During the waning phase of the moon
conditions.precautions: Use a moon filter and reduce exposure time.

conditions.name: Heavy rain
conditions.suggestion: Heavy rain is not suitable for astrophotography. Wait for the rain to stop.
conditions.precautions: Rain will damage your equipment, so keep it covered and protected.

conditions.name: Overcast
conditions.suggestion: Cloud cover may block the stars, but you could still capture a moody sky.
conditions.precautions: Clouds can diffuse light, creating a softer image with less contrast.

conditions.name: Thunderstorms
conditions.suggestion: Avoid going out during a thunderstorm for safety. Wait for the storm to pass.
conditions.precautions: Lightning poses a danger to both you and your equipment.
